The claim states that super PACs raised: 180 million in the last two years, with roughly half of it coming from fewer than 200 super-rich people and roughly 20 percent from corporations.
The claim is supported by articles in Po: which describe the findings of the "Auctioning Democracy: The Rise of Super PACs & the 2012 Election" report authored by Demos and U.S. PIRG.
The report states that from the advent o: donors contributed a total of $181 million in "itemized individual contributions" to super PACs, with contributions from donors who give more than $200.
The report found that 196 people donated: 100,000 or more to super PACs, which supports the claim that fewer than 200 super-rich individuals contributed a significant portion of the funds.
